title: Chipotle Stock Is Surging and Pershing Square Is Selling Millions of Dollars of Shares
text:
Text size

Bill Ackman’s Pershing Square Capital Management disclosed that it again trimmed its investment in Chipotle Mexican Grill stock.

Two of the hedge fund’s affiliates sold 58,400 Chipotle shares (ticker: CMG) on Sept. 26 and 27 for a total of $47.6 million, or an average of $815.49 each, according to a form Pershing Square filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission. Pershing Square L.P. and Pershing Square International Ltd. sold the shares through what is known as a Rule 10b5-1 plan. An investor sets values such as stock volume and price, and when preset conditions are met, the plan automatically executes a buy or sell transaction, as directed.

Ackman’s fund now has total ownership of 1,724,310 Chipotle shares.

Pershing Square noted in the SEC form that the Chipotle stock sale was “related to portfolio management.” Pershing Square declined to comment beyond the regulatory filing.

Editor's Choice

Chipotle stock’s surge has been accelerating. Shares gained 50% in 2018 and through Monday’s close they sport a gain of 94.6% so far in 2019. By contrast, the S&P 500 has managed to rise 18.7% year to date. Chipotle stock set a record intraday high of $857.90 on Sept. 9.

Pershing Square has been selling into the strength this year. Including sales of Chipotle stock in February and in June of this year, the fund has now sold 140,000 shares for $141.6 million.

Inside Scoop is a regular Barron’s feature covering stock transactions by corporate executives and board members—so-called insiders—as well as large shareholders, politicians, and other prominent figures. Due to their insider status, these investors are required to disclose stock trades with the Securities and Exchange Commission or other regulatory groups.

description: Chipotle stock has nearly doubled this year. Bill Ackman’s hedge fund Pershing Square continues trimming its stake, selling $48 million of Chipotle stock near the end of September.
